The **Pen of the Void** is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"). It is [gnostic](/wiki/Gnostic "Gnostic")-aligned and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is an [athame](/wiki/Athame "Athame").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

  - [2.1 Single-blade form](#Single-blade_form)
  - [2.2 Dual-blade form](#Dual-blade_form)
  - [2.3 Pen binding](#Pen_binding)
  - [2.4 Spirit effects](#Spirit_effects)

## Generation

The Pen of the Void can be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for unlike other quest artifacts in dNetHack and its variants, and can be left behind as part of a [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") level.

The Pen of the Void the guaranteed first [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") for [Binders](/wiki/Binder "Binder"), and can be enhanced into the role's [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"). If they somehow do not obtain the Pen of the Void via sacrifice prior to entering the [Binder quest](/wiki/Binder_quest "Binder quest") goal, then it will be placed on the square of the [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis") [Acererak](/wiki/Acererak "Acererak") at level creation - when generated this way, The Pen of the Void will be cursed and at an [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") of +5.

## Description

The Pen of the Void is a somewhat complex artifact, and appears in two different forms.

### Single-blade form

In most cases, the Pen of the Void appears as a normal athame, though it can only be [enchanted](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_weapon "Scroll of enchant weapon") to +5 - attempts to enchant the Pen further will simply fail rather than vaporize it.

In this form, the Pen can store one [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") (as detailed below) and has no #[invoke](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") effect. [Reading](/wiki/Read "Read") the Pen will show that it was once a dual-bladed athame, but the second blade has been snapped off - for a non-Binder the Pen will always be single-bladed, as [the double-bladed form](#Dual-blade_form) can only be created by Binders that have killed Acererak.

### Dual-blade form

Once a Binder slays Acererak, the Pen takes on its dual-bladed form - if the Binder already holds the Pen, it will be transformed into this form. The dual-blade Pen of the Void deals double damage, can be enchanted to +10, and can store two spirits; the effects of stored spirits also increase. Reading the Pen will show that it has both blades.

Invoking the restored Pen activates its "Void Chime" power: For the next 5 turns, any spirits stored in the blade count as being bound to the character as well, and all spirits bound to the player count as being in the Pen. While the Void Chime is sounding, breaking a spirit's taboo does not unbind it. The Void Chime also resets the cooldowns of all spirit powers.

### Pen binding

If a Binder with no free slots attempts to bind a spirit while wielding the Pen of the Void, the spirit may instead be stored in the Pen. The spirit's binding timeout is set as normal, and its seal appears on the Pen. Spirits stored in the Pen modify the artifact in some way in lieu of their usual abilities, and the character is not subject to their taboos. If the Pen is single-bladed, a character may only bind one spirit inside it, while the dual-bladed Pen can store two spirits. Reading the Pen will reveal what spirits are inside it.
